name: Communication Audit
description: Weekly review of message clarity, response quality, and communication effectiveness

schedule.rationale: Friday 5pm - end of work week is natural time for communication review

payload.message:
Run weekly communication audit.

Analyze the past week's interactions:

## üìù Message Clarity
- Count messages requiring clarification/follow-up
- Identify ambiguous responses
- Spot patterns in miscommunication

## ‚ö° Response Quality
- Average response time
- Completeness of answers
- Proactive suggestions offered

## üéØ Effectiveness Metrics
- Tasks completed first try vs. iterations
- User satisfaction indicators (thanks, positive feedback)
- Times user corrected agent understanding

## üîç Patterns Identified
- Topics where communication breaks down
- Time-of-day correlation with quality
- Message length vs. clarity

## üí° Improvement Recommendations
- Top 2-3 specific changes to make
- Communication anti-patterns to avoid
- Successful patterns to reinforce

Report format:
```
üìä Communication Audit - Week of [date]

Clarity: [score/10] ([trend])
Quality: [score/10] ([trend])
Effectiveness: [score/10] ([trend])

Key Issues:
- [Issue 1]
- [Issue 2]

Recommendations:
1. [Action item]
2. [Action item]
```

Keep under 800 chars. Focus on actionable improvements.

configuration.schedule: Weekly Friday. Adjust to match your review cycle.
configuration.metrics: Customize metrics based on what matters to your workflow
configuration.delivery: Posts to main session by default. Enable deliver:true for Telegram/Discord.
configuration.scoring: Subjective 1-10 scores. Agent estimates based on interaction patterns.

recommendedFor: Users wanting to optimize agent communication
Teams training agents for specific workflows
tips: Pair with daily-workflow-feedback for daily + weekly coverage
Track scores over multiple weeks to measure improvement
Share audit results with team if using OpenClaw collaboratively
Use recommendations to update SOUL.md communication guidelines
